originalTitle: Kenyans drop flowers for Valentine's bouquets of cash. Not everyone is impressed
title: Kenyans drop flowers for Valentine's bouquets of cash. Not everyone is impressed
content: Bouquets of cash have been blooming in popularity in Kenya but recent warnings may slow the trend.

originalTitle: Sudanese city had 6,000 killed in three days, UN says
title: Sudanese city had 6,000 killed in three days, UN says
content: Paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) committed the atrocities in el-Fasher, says a UN report.

originalTitle: South Africa to deploy troops to tackle crime gangs
title: South Africa to deploy troops to tackle crime gangs
content: President Cyril Ramaphosa says the army will work with the police to fight organised crime and illegal mining.

originalTitle: This Valentine’s Day, chocolate comes with new risks
title: This Valentine’s Day, chocolate comes with new risks
content: Climate shocks and deforestation are reshaping cocoa supply and pushing prices into a more volatile era.

originalTitle: Why the BNP won Bangladesh’s post-uprising election
title: Why the BNP won Bangladesh’s post-uprising election
content: Jamaat’s surge reshaped the contest, but constituency arithmetic and network power determined the outcome.

originalTitle: US pressures Vanuatu at UN over ICJ’s landmark climate change ruling
title: US pressures Vanuatu at UN over ICJ’s landmark climate change ruling
content: A cable seen by Al Jazeera says the US 'strongly objects' to the island nation seeking support for the ICJ's ruling.

originalTitle: World's rules-based order 'no longer exists', Germany's Merz warns
title: World's rules-based order 'no longer exists', Germany's Merz warns
content: "Our freedom is not guaranteed" in an era of big powers, the German chancellor tells Munich's security summit.

originalTitle: US homeland security shutdown could mean airport delays, travel groups say
title: US homeland security shutdown could mean airport delays, travel groups say
content: The shutdown won't affect air traffic controllers but some TSA workers may go without pay.

originalTitle: Can Bangladesh's new leader bring change after election landslide?
title: Can Bangladesh's new leader bring change after election landslide?
content: Tarique Rahman is set to be Bangladesh's next prime minister, 18 months after mass protests ousted its longest-serving leader.

content: After Igor Tudor agrees to take charge of Tottenham for the remainder of the season, BBC Sport takes a look at what supporters can expect to see from his side.

title: 'Marvellous' Man City set WSL standard in rampant win
